name: Kronecker–Weber theorem
explained: The Kronecker–Weber theorem (often referred to as a foundational result rather than a conjecture in its final form) states that every finite abelian extension of the rational numbers Q is contained within some cycloticlean field. In other words, if K/Q is a finite Galois extension with abelian Galois group Gal(K/Q), then K is contained in a cyclotomic field Q(ζ_n) for some integer n, where ζ_n is a primitive n-th root of unity.
related_conjectures: Class Field Theory (a generalization that provides a complete description of abelian extensions of number fields)
Fermat's Last Theorem (Kronecker's Jugendtraum, a conjecture related to the Kronecker–Weber theorem, involves cyclotomic fields and generalizes it to other number fields)
